metadata.title: CVE-2016-7944 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in X.org libXfixes before 5.0.3 on 32-bit platforms mightallow remote X servers to gain privileges via a length value of INT_MAX,which triggers the client to stop reading data and get out of sync.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7944` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxfixes3 - 1:5.0.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxfixes package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:5.0.3-1').
